page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The majority of land in the area is farmed with very few areas which are unused.Most of the agricultural land is intensively managed{grassland}and has been so for some considerable time though at one time Deer rather than farm stock grazed in a Royal deer park which covered mostof this area.Now the grassland is grazed by cattle ,usually{dairy}cattle with the most popular breed being the Freisian.The other use of grassland is for{Silage which is the practice of cutting green grass,usually around the third week in May for the following three or four weeks.These "grass cuttings" are then stored in a barn or under a large plastic sheet and fed to the cattle in winter as winter feed.This is an increasingly popular way of storing winter fodder which has become common over the last fifteen or twenty years.
